page.title: 10BOOT HOUSES - DEFECTS
page.content: In 1981-2 council houses on the {Saffron Lane Estate}were being modern- -ised, when defects in the structure of concrete houses was noticed. The houses,{built in 1926-8 by Messrs. {Henry Boot & Son,}were found to have crumbling concrete inside the reinfor- -ing pillars. This defect was found in Boot Houses on both the{Saffron Lane}and {Braunstone Estates}(about 1500 homes). The cost of demolishing and rebuilding new homes was reported to be{Â£21,000 (Leicester Mercury, October 1984), but this seemed to be the only solution. Demolition of the 1000 (approx.) Boot homes on the{Saffron Lane Estate began in{1985.}Working a{BLOCK}at a time the occupiers are re-housed, the homes{demolished}and{new houses built. The tennants can remain re-housed, or have the new home on their old site.
